question.title: Tomcat + Eclipse: "The filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect" when running Maven web project
question.body:
I am working on a Maven web project in Eclipse with Tomcat. When I click Run on Server → Tomcat 10 in Eclipse (on my dev server), instead of console logs, I immediately get a Windows dialog box: “The filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect” and then an empty Notepad opens.

My setup:

  • Windows 2019 statndard
  • Eclipse 4.35
  • Tomcat 10.1.44
  • Java 21
  • Maven project (packaging is war)

Project location:

D:\Java_Upgrade_code\LatestCSCode\frankservice

What I tried:

  • Clean project and rebuild (mvn clean install)
  • Checked pom.xml → packaging is war
  • Deleted and re-added Tomcat server in Eclipse
  • Changed server deploy location
  • Checked project facets (Dynamic Web Module enabled)

But still the same error occurs.

My web.xml (simplified):

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<web-app xmlns="https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/jakartaee"
         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/jakartaee
                             https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/jakartaee/web-app_6_0.xsd"
         version="6.0">

  <welcome-file-list>
    <welcome-file>index.html</welcome-file>
  </welcome-file-list>
</web-app>

On my local machine (Windows 10, Tomcat in C:\Tomcat9), the project runs fine. On the dev server (Tomcat in D:\Java_Upgrade_code\apache-tomcat-10.1.44), I get the dialog box error above.

Why does Eclipse/Tomcat show “The filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect” (with empty Notepad) only on the dev server, and how can I fix it? Is this related to Tomcat install path or Windows path length restrictions?

question_comments.body: I recommend to ensure the question includes enough detail for a minimal reproducible example.
You mentioned Maven more than once. Are you launching through Maven or from the "Run on Server" launcher? What's the full output including the error message?
